snippet: Detroit reached yet another tentative agreement to settle a pension debt with UBS and Bank of America Merrill Lynch and will file the $85 million plan in a few days in federal bankruptcy court, the state-appointed emergency manager Kevyn Orr said.
abstract: Detroit's emergency manager Kevyn Orr says city has reached yet another tentative agreement to settle pension debt with UBS and Bank of America Merrill Lynch and will file $85 million plan in a few days in federal bankruptcy court.
lead_paragraph: Detroit reached yet another tentative agreement to settle a pension debt with UBS and Bank of America Merrill Lynch and will file the $85 million plan in a few days in federal bankruptcy court, the state-appointed emergency manager Kevyn Orr said.

headline.main: Detroit in New Agreement Over Its Pension Debt
headline.print_headline: Detroit in New Agreement Over Its Pension Debt
